newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber futures uneven ahead of Fed news.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber futures uneven ahead of Fed news.

text.p: CME lumber futures continued to trade unevenly early Tuesday and ran up for gains after a lower start before slipping again in latest action ahead of expected news on interest rates, traders said.
At 0946 CDT, lumber stood $0.50 per thousand board feet lower to $1.30 higher with July up $0.10 at $400.00 and only September off at $387.40 per tbf.
Futures continued were choppy awaiting fresh direction from cash markets and the latest word on interest rates.
A regular meeting of the central bank's Federal Open Market Committee is currently underway. An announcement updating Fed monetary policy is expected at around 1315 CDT/1815 GMT.
July lumber futures moved over the $400 level but ran into increased selling interest as it widened its premium to the latest cash market, traders said.
